name: Walker Attack
description: You have been attacked by a Walker.

results.text:
They come after you, but you got away.
Take one point of stress.

You manage to hold the walker off, but it drools all over your face.
You start vomiting heavily.

Take one stress point.

They have you cornered, and you know it’s probably the end.
But somehow you survive.
Describe what happens.

Take one stress point.
You kill it, but you break or lose your weapon or something else important.

You hold it down and crack its head with a stone.

Take one stress point.

It pulls the hair from your head as it tries to drag you close enough to bite.
You punch it in the face until it dies.

Take one point of damage.

It headbutts you and throws you to the floor.
But then you kill it.

Take one point of damage.

Its dead weight pushes into you as you kill it, so you hit the back of your head on the ground.

Take one point of damage.

As you fight it, you accidentally cut yourself on something sharp.

Take one point of damage and take one more if you don’t succeed with a Medicine roll to stop the blood loss.

You jump to get away from them.
Make a Mobility roll.

If you fail, you fall and take one point of damage.

They get on top off you, but you manage to slay them and avoid being bitten.
You must make a Force roll to push them off.

If you fail, you black out for D6 minutes pinned down by the corpses.

It chases after you.
You get away, but you must make a Mobility roll to not stumble and fall.

If you fail, you hit your head on something sharp and takes two points of damage.

It grabs your head to bite you in the face.
Make a Close Combat roll to keep it from headbutting you repeatedly in its attempts to take a bite.

Take two points of damage if you fail.

It bites at your clothes, at your hair, and even at your shoes.
But you manage to elbow it in the face, several times, until the skull breaks.
Your arm is in bad shape.

Take two points of damage.

Somehow you kill it and hit yourself at the same time.

Take your own weapon’s damage.

You fight it on the ground for what seems like forever, but finally you kill it.

Take one point each of damage and stress.

It tears off one of your ears and you bleed heavily.

Take two points of damage.

36 You’re stuck between two walkers, who are pulling you in opposite directions.
You feel skin, muscles, and sinews in your arms and legs being stretched out and snapping.

Take two points of damage and make an Endure roll not to pass out for [[1d6]] minutes.

It repeatedly cuts and stabs you with a rusty, sharp object wedged through one of its hands.

Take two points of damage.

You lose your balance, and it forces you backwards.
You bump into sharp objects; fall over and hits your head; stumbles, severely twisting your ancles and wrists.

Take two points of damage.

It gets on top of you and your head is hammered against the ground before you can kill it.

Take three points of damage.

It breaks your arm while you wrestle it.

Take three points of damage.

It tears off your left kneecap with its teeth and starts chewing on it.
You need to amputate the whole leg within [[1d6×10]] minutes, or you die.

Take three points of damage.

You protect your face, but it bites you in both earlobes.
Your only chance to survive is to cut the earlobes off within [[1d6]] hours.

Take two points of damage.

It is just a small scratch, but within days the infection will take root, and you will die.
Your only chance is to carve off the infected meat within [[1d6]] hours.

Take two points of damage.

You get bitten on a toe. Your only chance to survive is to amputate the foot within [[1d6]] hours.

Take two points of damage.

One of your fingers gets bitten off and the infection from the bite spreads into your body.
Your only chance to survive is to amputate the hand within [[1d6]] minutes.

Take two points of damage.

You are bitten in the stomach.

The wound is not that deep, but soon you will get a fever, and within [[1d6]] days you will be dead.

You are bitten in the throat.
Blood everywhere.

You die.

They bite you several times in the back.

Within [[1d6]] hours you are dead.

You manage to fight them off, but somehow you are tagged in the head, either by your own weapon or friendly fire.

You die cursing your bad luck.

As you grapple with a walker, you failed to notice another walker on the ground reaching for your leg.
It takes a huge bite out of your calf.
You fall screaming as both walkers overwhelms you.

You’ve lost a mortal amount of blood before you hit the ground.

You defeat it, and everything is fine.
But you failed to notice that one of them is still coming for you.

It bites into your back and you die screaming.

They surround you and push you to the ground.
For several seconds, you manage to fight them, but then one of them presses its face against your stomach and starts tearing out your intestines with its teeth.

You die screaming.

A walker bites you in the face and eats one of your eyes and your nose.

You try to fight it, but you soon bleed to death.

You are overwhelmed by walkers that tear the flesh from your bones.

You are dead.
